words.definition: To assess something means to judge the structure, purpose, or quality of it.
words.example: She assessed the condition of the toy car before buying it.

words.definition: To astonish someone means to greatly surprise them.
words.example: The amount of people that came to her party astonished her.

words.definition: To commence something means to begin it.
words.example: His speech commenced with a “thank you” to all who had helped him succeed.

words.definition: The essence of something is its important qualities or basic characteristics.
words.example: The essence of the argument was that we needed more time.

words.definition: To extract something means to remove it from something else.
words.example: The dentist had to extract one of my teeth.

words.definition: When something is fabulous, it is extremely good.
words.example: The food at the party was fabulous.

words.definition: Haste is speed in movement or action.
words.example: In order to get to the meeting on time, he left in haste.

words.definition: An impulse is a sudden desire to do something.
words.example: She had an impulse to buy the expensive dress.

words.definition: Latter describes something last in a series or the second of two things.
words.example: Of the two choices, the latter is the better one.

words.definition: A molecule is the smallest unit of a chemical substance.
words.example: A molecule of water is made up of hydrogen and oxygen.

words.definition: If something is ongoing, then it is still happening or developing.
words.example: The investigation is ongoing and could take several months.

words.definition: If something is pharmaceutical, it is related to the development and sale of drugs.
words.example: He works for a large pharmaceutical company.

words.definition: If something is precise, it is exact and correct.
words.example: The scientist gave a precise measurement of the substance.

words.definition: Proximity is the state of being near to something or someone.
words.example: The proximity of the two buildings made it easy to walk between them.

words.definition: Publicity is public notice or attention given to someone or something.
words.example: The movie received a lot of publicity before it was released.

words.definition: A remedy is a cure for an illness, a problem, or an unfair situation.
words.example: A glass of warm milk is a good remedy for insomnia.

words.definition: Significance is the quality of being important.
words.example: The significance of the discovery was not understood for many years.

words.definition: If something is subsequent, it comes after something else in time.
words.example: The first meeting was successful, and subsequent meetings were even better.

words.definition: If something is synthetic, it is made by humans and not found in nature.
words.example: The shirt is made from synthetic material.

words.definition: If something is terminal, it is at the end of something else.
words.example: The bus arrived at the terminal and everyone got off.
